attributes.action: create halls of residence for mp's and scrap second homes and associated expenses
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The government of the United Kingdom should provide accommodation for ministers of parliament through the provision of Halls of Residence. Upon election to office a minister of parliament should be assigned a dormitory at the said halls of residence, and upon exit from public service the minister should vacate his dormitory. 

This system of allocated domitories which impose no cost on the occupants are sufficient to allow ministers to do their duties without incurring expenses should they wish to stay away from home. 

This system also paves the way to eliminating expenses claimed by ministers for accomodation, furniture, carpets, lighting, kitchen taps, garden gnomes, and of course bath plugs.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
